result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin N Saavedra Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martin N Saavedra Jr appeared by video, in custody  Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Michael J Cerniglia is unable to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martin N Saavedra Jr not in court, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was present. Defense Counsel informed the court that he is in trial and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a  Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Martin N Saavedra not in court, in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. HOC unable to produce defendant due to technical issues. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Martin N Saavedra in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Martin N Saavedra in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martin N Saavedra appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
